oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Work on the East Nashville Urban Renewal Project Preliminary Report, 1958
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Edward Schumacher and P. Panders of the Nashville Housing Authority working on the preliminary report for the East Nashville Urban Renewal Project, Spring 1958. The preliminary report was later approved in June of 1958, making the project the largest urban renewal project in the U.S. at the time. The East Nashville Urban Renewal Project comprised 2,256 acres of reclaimed city property, containing 5,570 structures with 8,617 dwelling units, and it anticipated approximately $21,000,000 in capital improvements. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
